Several alanates having one cation or bi-cation have been produced by the metathesis reaction between NaAlH 4 or LiAlH 4 and metal halides in organic solvents, such as THF or Et 2O [ 30]. One practical reason for this is that NaAlH 4 and LiAlH 4 are the only commercially available alanates. This type of reaction dates back from 1950, from the work of Wiberg and Bauer [ 27], and the reaction can be summarized as:
